skill.name: cosmic-database
skill.description: Access COSMIC cancer mutation database. Query somatic mutations, Cancer Gene Census, mutational signatures, gene fusions, for cancer research and precision oncology. Requires authentication.
skill.summary: Access COSMIC cancer mutation database. Query somatic mutations, Cancer Gene Census, mutational sign...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: The skill is a legitimate bioinformatics tool for accessing the COSMIC cancer database. Static analysis flagged many false positives from documentation examples. The actual code only makes authenticated API requests to COSMIC and downloads cancer research data files.

low_findings.description: Hardcoded COSMIC API URL for legitimate data access
HTTP requests to COSMIC API for authenticated file downloads
File writing to save downloaded COSMIC database files

content.user_title: Download cancer mutation data from COSMIC database
content.value_statement: Researchers need access to comprehensive cancer mutation data for precision oncology studies. This skill provides authenticated access to COSMIC, the world's largest database of somatic mutations in cancer.
actual_capabilities: Download authenticated COSMIC mutation data files
Access Cancer Gene Census with 700+ curated cancer genes
Retrieve mutational signatures for signature analysis
Query structural variants and gene fusion data
Support GRCh37 and GRCh38 genome assemblies
limitations: Requires free academic registration or commercial license
Large files may take time to download
COSMIC updates quarterly - data version matters
Authentication credentials needed for each session

use_cases.title: Analyze mutation patterns in tumor samples
use_cases.description: Download COSMIC mutations data to identify recurrent mutations in specific cancer types for research publications.

use_cases.title: Annotate variants with cancer significance
use_cases.description: Use Cancer Gene Census to filter and prioritize variants from patient sequencing data.

use_cases.title: Identify drug resistance mutations
use_cases.description: Query resistance mutation data to guide treatment decisions for cancer patients.

prompt_templates.title: Download mutation data
prompt_templates.scenario: Get COSMIC mutations for a specific gene
prompt_templates.prompt: Download the COSMIC mutation export file for GRCh38 and show me how to filter for TP53 mutations using pandas

prompt_templates.title: Access gene census
prompt_templates.scenario: Get list of known cancer genes
prompt_templates.prompt: Download the Cancer Gene Census file and extract all genes classified as oncogenes

prompt_templates.title: Analyze signatures
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the COSMIC mutational signatures data and explain the different signature types available

prompt_templates.title: Batch download
prompt_templates.prompt: Download both mutation data and gene fusions for GRCh38, then show me how to read both files

output_examples.input: Download COSMIC mutations and show TP53 variants
output: Found 15,847 TP53 mutations across all cancer types
- Codon 273: R273H (high frequency in many tumors)

best_practices: Always specify the correct genome assembly (GRCh38 recommended)
Use 'latest' version for current data or specific version for reproducibility
Cache downloaded files locally to avoid repeated API calls
Check file sizes before downloading - some files exceed 1GB
anti_patterns: Do not share COSMIC credentials in code or documentation
Avoid downloading entire database repeatedly - use specific files needed
Do not use GRCh37 unless working with legacy data
Never bypass authentication - respect COSMIC licensing terms

faq.question: Is COSMIC access free?
faq.answer: Academic users get free access after registration. Commercial users need a license from QIAGEN.

faq.question: How do I get COSMIC credentials?
faq.answer: Register at https://cancer.sanger.ac.uk/cosmic/register with your academic institution email.

faq.question: What file formats are available?
faq.answer: COSMIC provides TSV, CSV, and VCF formats. Use TSV for tabular data and VCF for variant analysis.

faq.question: How often is COSMIC updated?
faq.answer: COSMIC releases new versions quarterly. Use 'latest' for current data or specific version for reproducibility.

faq.question: Can I download the entire database?
faq.answer: Yes, but individual files can be several GB. Consider downloading only data types you need for analysis.

faq.question: What's the difference between GRCh37 and GRCh38?
faq.answer: GRCh38 is the current human reference genome. GRCh37 is legacy - use GRCh38 unless working with older data.
